lexUnit.name: proliferate.v

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: reproduce rapidly; increase rapidly in number.

sentence.text: According to Professor Charles Boudouresque of Marseilles University , " the Mediterranean faces an ecological disaster if the seaweed continues to proliferate at its present rate " .

Unlike the somewhat parochial hip hop magazines that have proliferated during the last few years , Vibe 's vibe ( assessed through a preview issue , which may be misleading ) aims for a mixed appeal .
In Orkney , favourite destination for many southerners fleeing the rat race , personal computers and modems are proliferating like the local rabbits .
We examined the mitotic rate of Rat-1/c-Myc-ER cells that were proliferating in low serum under the influence of Î² -oestradiol-activated c-Myc , with and without Bcl-2 expression .
While such links proliferate in affluent countries , the global scope of drugs-related crime , political violence and AIDS reminds us that poor countries are far from immune .
For reasons as yet unexplained , genital warts proliferate markedly during pregnancy , and they can assume gigantic proportions if left untreated .
As with the Casket Letters , conflicting theories concerning the event have proliferated ever since .
